N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 504.6 - Administrative review

State Regulations
(a) An
administrative appeal may be requested by the individual, the individual's
guardian or another individual actively involved in the care of the individual
and who can represent the individual's interests within 30 days of receipt of
written notification of the placement determined to be appropriate. Such
request shall be forwarded in writing to the commissioner. (b) If a timely request is made, a hearing
shall be conducted by the commissioner or his/her designee. Such hearing shall
be presided over by an individual, designated by the commissioner, who has no
interest or bias in the matter involved. Both sides may call witnesses and
present relevant evidence. (c) A
hearing shall occur within 30 days of request for such appeal and every effort
shall be made to hold the review in a county of the State convenient to the
individual requesting the review. (d) The commissioner or his/her designee
shall issue a written determination within 30 days of the administrative
review. The reasons supporting the determination shall be fully explained in
the determination, which shall address all specific issues raised by the
individual and his or her representatives. All clinical reports and other
documents considered will be attached to the determination. If it is determined
that the proposed placement is appropriate for the individual receiving
transitional care funding, the Commissioner of Mental Health shall notify the
local department of social services which shall discontinue funding for
transitional care for such individual on the transfer date. (e) If an administrative appeal is not
requested within the 30 days stipulated in subdivision (a) of this section, the
process for placement will begin and funding of the transitional care will
terminate on the transfer date. Notes
